text: Scaptia beyonceae is a species of horse fly found in north-east Queensland, Australia. It was first recorded in 1981 but not scientifically described until 2011. The fly is named after American recording artist and actress Beyonc√©. Scaptia beyonceae has a golden tip to its abdomen, formed by a dense patch of golden hairs. Hence its name. == References == Category:Flies
title: Scaptia beyonceae
